item.title: Rubbish and plant material blocking path, 31st October
item.description:
I uploaded this issue around a week ago, it was marked off as "completed" last Friday, but as I've just walked past and seen- this is not the case. It hasn't been touched, and in fact looks as if there is more than prior. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Maidstone Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pebbles in road, 31st October
item.description:
Previously reported ref 8355688 Fixed. There are pebbles/ stones in the road by the roundabout in Brook St/ Bexley Road up until Mill Rd which have been dropped by a lorry a require clearing ASAP We have been out and swept all the pebbles into the curb, this is not satisfactory as they could easily be driven over and flick up into the air. please get a road sweeper out to remove all the stones /pebbles before an accident happens .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Street, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged road surface in the triangular island, 31st October
item.description:
Surface very defective and uneven. Could cause damage to vehicles turning in and out of Broom Mead / Broomhill Rise. Requires urgent attention.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broomhill Rise, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Union flags illegally erected on street furniture, 31st October
item.description:
The union flags illegally attached to the lamp posts on Sidcup Hill are a political statement and are causing myself and others anxiety, as they are clearly intended to send an intimidating message to members of the local community. It is not good enough to say that the council is unaware of community tensions and therefore you do not need to address this issue. Greenwich council have been removing flags that are illegally attached to lamp posts and I would appreciate reassurance that Bexley will do the same.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sussex Road, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Benares Road has not been swept for at least 3 weeks, 31st October
item.description:
Benares Road is filthy and has not been cleaned/swept for at least 3 weeks Drains are covered with leaves and rubbish. Road full of broken glass, bottles, canisters, chewing gum, dog poo, you name it it's on Benares Road!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Benares Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Zebra crossing by St Josephâ€™s School, 31st October
item.description:

item.title: Suitable access required., 31st October
item.description:
A stepped side exit/entrance by the public toilets on Ridley road market needs to be appropriate for those hauling weighty shopping in their trolleys, for pushchairs, wheel chairs and mobility scooters. Make a nonslip ramp.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Birkbeck Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
